intro: Crepis virens var. runcinata, commonly known as the slender mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its leaves are narrow and often have a hairy texture, while the flowers are usually yellow or whitish in color. It is a perennial species that produces small, wind-dispersed seeds.
